title: Kohli surpasses Sangakkara as second-highest scorer in international cricket
byline: India’s Virat Kohli on Sunday became the second-highest scorer across the three international cricket formats during his match-winning 93 in the first ODI against New Zealand.

title: Sri Lanka seal gritty T20 win over Pakistan to level series
byline: Sri Lanka eked out a hard fought 14-run victory over Pakistan in the third T20 at rain-hit Dambulla on Sunday, easing their batting jitters and squaring the three-match series 1-1.

title: ICC U19 Men’s Cricket World Cup 2026: Warm-ups Day 3 wrap
byline: Afghanistan and Sri Lanka registered morale-boosting wins on Day 3 of warm-up fixtures in the lead-up to the ICC Under-19 Men’s Cricket World Cup 2026.

title: Barca edge Real Madrid in thrilling Spanish Super Cup final
byline: Barcelona retained the Spanish Super Cup with an entertaining 3-2 Clasico win over Real Madrid in Saudi Arabia on Sunday.

title: A/L exam to resume today after cyclone disruption
byline: The remaining subjects of the General Certificate of Education (GCE) Advanced Level (A/L) Examination, which were postponed due to Cyclone Ditwah, will resume from today (12), the Examinations Department announced.

title: Test delays deepen Ondansetron doubts
byline: After nearly a month, serious concerns have been raised over a considerable delay in reviewing a request to conduct independent testing on withdrawn batches of the Ondansetron injection, as well as the non-release of related laboratory findings.

title: Three killed in accident in Mundalama
byline: Three people were killed in a road accident that occurred this morning (12) in the Navadankulama area of Mundalama along the Puttalam–Colombo main road, police said.

title: Malaysia and Indonesia block Musk’s Grok over sexually explicit deepfakes
byline: Malaysia and Indonesia have blocked access to Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence (AI) chatbot Grok over its ability to produce sexually explicit deepfakes.

title: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi Arrives in Sri Lanka on transit visit
byline: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake early this morning (12) during a brief transit stop while returning to China after completing an official visit to South Africa.

title: Companies from India, China, America, Japan eye Sapugaskanda oil refinery
byline: Twenty companies including from countries such as China, India, the United States and Japan have responded to Sri Lanka’s invitation for Expression of Interest (EOI) to develop and expand the Sapugaskanda oil refinery, an official said yesterday.

title: Trump tells Cuba to ’make a deal, before it is too late’
byline: Donald Trump has urged Cuba to ’’make a deal’’ or face consequences, warning that the flow of Venezuelan oil and money would now stop.

title: Kandy railway line could be restored within a year: Deputy Minister
byline: The restoration of the Kandy railway line which was damaged by Cyclone Ditwah will be completed within a year, Deputy Minister of Transport Prasanna Gunasena said.

title: Scam behind Norochcholai coal supply tender?
byline: Whilst highlighting a serious scam with regard to the awarding of tender pertaining to supply of coal to Norochcholai power plant, the Frontline Socialist Party yesterday urged President Anura Kumara Dissanayake to carry out a probe on it.

title: Vijitha Herath holds meeting with Chinese Foreign Minister
byline: Minister Vijitha Herath met with Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi this morning (12) during the latter’s official visit to Sri Lanka.

title: ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ national programme to be launched tomorrow
byline: Arrangements have been made to hold the inaugural ceremony of the national programme ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’, which has been introduced to effectively steer the country’s rebuilding process, on Tuesday, 13th  January at the Lotus Hall of the Bandaranaike Memorial International Conference Hall (BMICH) in Colombo, under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Government to introduce concessional loan package for MSMEs
byline: The Development Finance Department is set to launch a concessional loan package for micro, small, and medium-scale entrepreneurs, in line with government directives, Fiscal Policy Department Director General Manjula Hettiarachchi said.

title: Keheliya’s corruption case to be recalled on Feb. 13
byline: The Colombo High Court Judge Mohamed Mihal today ordered that the case filed by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption against former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella, his son Ramith Rambukwella, his daughter Amali Nayanika Rambukwella, and their domestic aide Nipuni Krishnajina be recalled on February 13.

title: British tourist rescued from strong currents at Mirissa Beach
byline: A 65-year-old British national was rescued after nearly drowning at Mirissa Beach yesterday (11), police said.

title: Thick mist in Central hills
byline: Heavy mist prevailing in the Western slopes of the Central hills has disrupted civilian life in several areas and obstructed transportation.

title: Low pressure area moving away
byline: The low-pressure area located over the Gulf of Mannar is weakening further and moving away from the island, Department of Meteorology said yesterday.

title: Donald Trump declares himself as ’Acting President of Venezuela’, posts on Truth Social
byline: In his Truth Social post, US President Donald Trump recognises himself as the ’Acting President of Venezuela’. Credit: Screen grab/Reuters

title: Wimal Weerawansa launches continuous ‘Satyagraha’ at Education Ministry
byline: Former Minister Wimal Weerawansa, accompanied by civil society representatives and supporters, has begun a continuous ‘Satyagraha’ protest in front of the Education Ministry.

title: Chalamet beats DiCaprio to Golden Globes glory
byline: Chalamet, 30, continued his pursuit of greatness, and an Oscar, by beating stars including Leonardo DiCaprio and George Clooney to the award for best actor in a musical or comedy for table tennis caper Marty Supreme.

title: Complaint filed with CID over distorted Sri Lanka State Emblem
byline: The Doctors’ Trade Union Alliance for Medical and Civil Rights Chairman, Specialist Dr. Chamal Sanjeewa has filed a complaint with the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) over the alleged alteration of Sri Lanka’s State Emblem on the official website of the Ministry of Public Security.

title: Sri Lanka tightens drone laws after safety concerns
byline: The Civil Aviation Authority (CAA) said that it will introduce a comprehensive programme to regulate the use of drones in Sri Lanka, with particular emphasis on drones used for commercial purposes.

title: Trump tells Cuba to ’make a deal, before it is too late’
byline: Donald Trump has urged Cuba to ’’make a deal’’ or face consequences, warning that the flow of Venezuelan oil and money would now stop.

title: Sri Lanka Social Security Board records historic progress in 2025
byline: The Sri Lanka Social Security Board (SSSB), operating under the Rural Development, Social Security and Community Empowerment Ministry, achieved its highest level of progress in history in 2025.

title: China pledges full support for Sri Lanka’s post-cyclone recovery
byline: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi, on a brief visit to Sri Lanka this morning (12), has reaffirmed his country’s commitment to supporting Sri Lanka’s reconstruction efforts following Cyclone Ditva. Wang Yi gave assurances of personal intervention to assist in rehabilitating critical infrastructure, including roads, railways, and bridges affected by the disaster.

title: Australian Border Force provides high-standard scanners to Sri Lanka
byline: Two high-technology scanners were handed over to the Sri Lanka Customs Department by the Australian Border Force, specifically for use at the Jaffna International Airport and the Kankesanthurai Port.

title: Elephant kills 20 in Indian state as rescue efforts continue
byline: At least 20 people have been killed by a wild elephant in nine days in the eastern Indian state of Jharkhand, officials have said, adding that the animal is yet to be captured.

title: Severe lightning warning issued for several provinces and districts
byline: The Natural Hazards Early Warning Centre of the Meteorological Department has issued an advisory warning of severe lightning accompanied by thundershowers for Western, North-Western, and Sabaragamuwa provinces, as well as the Galle and Matara districts. The alert, released at 12:00 noon today (January 12), is valid until 11:00 p.m. tonight.

title: Meta blocks 550,000 accounts under Australia’s social media ban
byline: About 550,000 accounts were blocked by Meta during the first days of Australia’s landmark social media ban for kids.

title: Daily Mirror warns public of fake article circulating on social media
byline: An article currently being shared on social media platforms bearing the Daily Mirror logo is fake.

title: Couple arrested at BIA with smuggled cigarettes worth Rs. 15 million
byline: Two Sri Lankan passengers who attempted to illegally bring in a large consignment of foreign-made cigarettes valued at around Rs. 15 million were arrested by officers of the Airport Police Narcotics Bureau in the early hours of January 12 at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), Katunayake.

title: Elle Gunawansa Thera urges Cabinet reshuffle, PM to be removed as Education Minister
byline: The Chairman of the National Movement for the Protection of the Nation, Venerable Elle Gunawansa Thera, has sent a letter to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake requesting that Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya be removed from the post of Minister of Education and that a Cabinet reshuffle be carried out.

title: UNP seniors participate in Sajith’s birthday celebration
byline: Senior members of the United National Party (UNP), including Deputy Leader Ruwan Wijewardene and National Organiser Sagala Ratnayake, participated in a religious ceremony held at the Gangarama Temple in Hunupitiya to mark the birthday of Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa today, indicating that a political alliance between the UNP and the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) may be on the cards.

title: Four killed in head-on collision in Mullaitivu
byline: Four persons died and one was injured in a head-on collision between a bus and a car in the Murasumoddai area on the Paranthan-Mullaitivu main road, police said.

title: Court frees army commando officers arrested while carrying sniper type firearm
byline: Two suspects arrested while in possession of a sniper type firearm in front of the Criminal Investigation Department are officers attached to the Sri Lanka Army Commando Regiment, counsel appearing on behalf of the Sri Lanka Army informed the Fort Acting Magistrate Lahiru Silva today.

title: Speaker gave no orders on Parliament staff using drugs, alcohol, cigarettes: Parliamentary Secretariat
byline: The Parliamentary Secretariat has denied meida reports under the headline “Speaker Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne has decided to take strict action regarding a group of employees using drugs, alcohol and cigarettes within the Parliamentary premises”.

title: ACCIMT identifies 4,800 landslide-prone areas following cyclone Ditwah
byline: The Arthur C. Clarke Institute for Modern Technologies (ACCIMT) has identified around 4,800 landslide-prone areas in Sri Lanka, based on satellite imagery captured after Cyclone Ditwah, the institute confirmed today.

title: T20 World Cup ticket sales pass 2017 tournament total
byline: Ticket sales for this year’s Women’s T20 World Cup in England have already passed the total for the 50-over tournament in 2017.

title: Maha Sangha seeks action on Minister’s statements
byline: The National Sangha Conference Chairman Venerable Liyanwala Sasanarathana Thera, has warned that the government will soon face serious consequences if it fails to take appropriate action against Minister K.D. Lal Kantha over alleged derogatory and insulting remarks directed at the Maha Sangha.

title: Welimada district court registrar remanded
byline: Registrar of the Welimada District Court, who is alleged to have accepted a bribe of Rs. 500,000 to hand over possession in a land case in accordance with a District Court judgement, was ordered to be remanded till January 27 by Colombo Additional Magistrate Liyan Warusawithana yesterday.
